Y cada personaje tiene sus propias habilidades que le limitan y que le hacen tener ventajas especÃ­ficas (curador, reparador, bueno escapando, perdiendo el rastro, rescatador, asesino invisible, motosierra, con trampas, con hachas voladoras... etc). If you're searching for an asymmetrical, thus unbalanced game that forces you to play in a mmr system with no option to go for a casual match, then dead by daylight is for you ;]

It's a buggy mess like a Bethesda game.
While it has a horror theme the game is not scary and you can literally run circles around the killer and get away safely.
The community is entitled, toxic and it's like almost everyone is a sore loser.
fun and fast going.

[b]Perhaps the greatest asymmetric multiplayer horror game there is.[/b]
Dead by Daylight is strategic and nerve-wracking.

You play either as the Killer hunting down the team of four Survivors, or play as one of the Survivors. Both of these roles are fun and satisfying, and dominated by sneaking around to complete objectives.

Successfully completing objectives earns you Bloodpoints, an ingame currency you can use ingame to acquire new abilities for your Survivors and Killers; customized loadouts brings variety and planning to the game.

The game is constantly getting updates, balances, and new content (most prominently, new Killers). Additionally, the game's company, Behavior Interactive, is very responsive to the player base.

Dead by Daylight is a great, engaging horror game, with a good company and a good player community behind it. It is definitely worth the base price of $20 (but goes on sale for $10 nearly every month as well).

Our goal in the game is to escape from the murderer, we need to repair 5 of the generators located in different places on the game map 
the murderer need to kill us before the 4 survivors finish 5 generators., there are many different murderers and survivors in the game, and all of these characters have their own unique abilities. Playing with your friends is more enjoyable, but you can play alone. I recommend you to play a killer while you are alone.

Ein sehr gutes Spiel mit groÃŸem SpaÃŸfaktor und schÃ¶nem Ambiente fÃ¼r Horrorfans. DbD ist nicht schwierig zu lerne, aber biete immer Potential zur Verbesserung. Sowohl im Multiplayer mit Freunden als auch als einsamer Wolf kommt hier jeder auf seine Kosten. Abwechslungsreiche Spielerlebnisse durch die unterschiedlichen Maps, Modes, Items, Addons, Perks und CharakterfÃ¤higkeiten sowie regelmÃ¤ÃŸige Updates und Events in Verbindung mit den bekanntesten Szenerien aus der Horrorwelt von Film und Fernsehen (Halloween, Stranger Things, Saw, Nightmare on Elm Street uvm.) sorgen fÃ¼r eine beispiellose Langzeitmotivation, ohne dabei zu Ã¼berfordern. Aufgrund des Horroraspektes und des nicht zu ignorierenden Frustrationsfaktors sind starke Nerven empfehlenswert.

Good

Despite the decent reviews lately, and the nice words said about the updates and the dev team, I can't recommend Dead by Daylight (sorry!).

It's just a bit tacky and empty is all - feels unpolished and slightly unprofessional. That sounded snobby, I apologise.

The menu screens are nicely designed and laid out, and the co-op system seems to function more than sufficiently. The graphics, however, are pretty dull, as are the character animations. The replayability was a concern early on - I hadn't explored the game too far beyond character creation, perk setup, skills, leveling up and the game itself, but it seems to be fairly rinse-and-repeat. 

It's a fine game for $20 (and then half price when I picked it up), but I wouldn't play it repeatedly.
